member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.ClientNameAttribute
member.summary: Attribute used to provide additional metadata describing when a language client should be loaded.
member.remarks: When defined, language clients will only activate and/or handle individual features if an ILanguageClient's ClientName metadata matches wath's stored in a text buffer's properties.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.ClientNameAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Name of the language client.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.ClientNameAttribute.ClientName
member.summary: Gets the value which indicates the client name metadata.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.CodeRemoteContentDefinition
member.summary: Class which represents the remote and code-remote ContentTypes, which should be used as a base definition for all files that use remote language server. Use if language content type derives from "code" and if language content type derives from "text".

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.CodeRemoteContentDefinition.RemoteBaseTypeName
member.summary: Base remote ContentType name. Lights up language server features without activating TextMate.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.CodeRemoteContentDefinition.CodeRemoteBaseTypeName
member.summary: Base code remote ContentType name. Lights up language server features without activating TextMate.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.CodeRemoteContentDefinition.CodeRemoteContentTypeName
member.summary: Code remote ContentType name. Lights up all TextMate features (colorization, brace completion, folding ranges).

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.CodeRemoteContentDefinition.CodeRemoteTextMateColorizationTypeName
member.summary: Code remote colorization ContentType name. Activates TextMate colorization.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.CodeRemoteContentDefinition.CodeRemoteTextMateStructureTypeName
member.summary: Code remote structure ContentType name. Activates TextMate folding ranges.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.CodeRemoteContentDefinition.CodeRemoteTextMateBraceCompletionTypeName
member.summary: Code remote brace completion ContentType name. Activates TextMate brace completion.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.CodeRemoteContentDefinition.CodeRemoteTextMateIndentationTypeName
member.summary: Code remote smart indentation ContentType name. Activates TextMate smart indentation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.CodeRemoteContentDefinition.TextMateOnTypeIndentationContentTypeName
member.summary: On type indentation ContentType name. Activates TextMate on type indentation.
member.remarks: TODO : When we're able to add Editor NuGet package to this project, we can replace this constant by Microsoft.VisualStudio.Editor.CommonEditorConstants.TextMateOnTypeIndentationContentTypeName.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.CodeRemoteContentDefinition.RemoteBaseContentTypeDefinition
member.summary: Exports the remote base content type so extensions can inherit from it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.CodeRemoteContentDefinition.CodeRemoteBaseContentTypeDefinition
member.summary: Exports the code remote base content type so extensions can inherit from it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.CodeRemoteContentDefinition.CodeRemoteContentTypeDefinition
member.summary: Exports the code-remote content type definition so extensions can inherit from it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.CodeRemoteContentDefinition.CodeRemoteTextMateColorizationContentTypeDefinition
member.summary: Exports the code remote colorization content type so extensions can inherit from it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.CodeRemoteContentDefinition.CodeRemoteTextMateStructureContentTypeDefinition
member.summary: Exports the code remote structure content type so extensions can inherit from it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.CodeRemoteContentDefinition.CodeRemoteTextMateBraceCompletionContentTypeDefinition
member.summary: Exports the code remote brace completion content type so extensions can inherit from it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.CodeRemoteContentDefinition.CodeRemoteTextMateIndentationTypeDefinition
member.summary: Exports the code remote smart indentation service content type so extensions can inherit from it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.CodeRemoteContentDefinition.TextMateOnTypeIndentationContentTypeDefinition
member.summary: Exports the code remote indentation on typing content type so extensions can inherit from it.

Writer stream.

member.summary: Gets the reader stream.

member.summary: Gets the writer stream.

member.summary: Dispose pattern.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.DisableUserExperienceAttribute
member.summary: Export attribute which can be used to signify that a language client can disable user experience and editor interactions. Such a client will not be loaded by default, and will only be exposed via a LiveShare exposed interface.
member.remarks: When the client UX is disabled, the consumer of this attribute is responsible for manually activating the client and corresponding server via . This attribute is currently used to support LiveShare scenarios.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.DisableUserExperienceAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Value which indicates if a given language client should disable loading.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.DisableUserExperienceAttribute.DisableUserExperience
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether a language client is disabling User Experience.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.IAddressableLanguageClient
member.summary: Interface representing a language client that is addressable for callback calls sent specifically to them.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.IAddressableLanguageClient.UniqueName
member.summary: Gets the string to uniquely identify this language client for callbacks.
member.remarks: This property must be implemented and cannot return null or throw exceptions.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.ILanguageClient
member.summary: Interface representing a language client which connects to a language sever protocol based language server.
member.remarks:
A normal sequence of activation for the follows this pattern:
Visual Studio calls ,
The extension calls and awaits on the event before returning from ,
Visual Studio calls and awaits before returning from ,
The extension starts the LSP server and returns a to Visual Studio,
Visual Studio starts asynchronously initializing the server using the "initialize" and "initialized" LSP messages,
Visual Studio completes the event handling,
The extension completes the execution,
Visual Studio calls the method after the "initialize" and "initialized" LSP messages are exchanged (or the method in case of failure).

member.name: E:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.ILanguageClient.StartAsync
member.summary: Async event to indicate to Visual Studio that server should be started by calling . If the server is already started, this event will be ignored.
member.remarks: This event must be invoked in order to start the language server.

member.name: E:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.ILanguageClient.StopAsync
member.summary: Async event to indicate to Visual Studio that the server should be stopped by sending an LSP "shutdown" request. If the server is not started, this event will be ignored.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.ILanguageClient.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the language client (displayed to the user).
member.remarks: This property must be implemented and cannot return null or throw exceptions.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.ILanguageClient.ConfigurationSections
member.summary: Gets the configuration section names for the language client. This may be null if the language client does not provide settings.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.ILanguageClient.InitializationOptions
member.summary: Gets the initialization options object the client wants to send when 'initialize' message is sent. This may be null if the client does not need custom initialization options.
member.remarks: The object defined here must be JSON serializable.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.ILanguageClient.FilesToWatch
member.summary: Gets the list of file names to watch for changes. Changes will be sent to the server via 'workspace/didChangeWatchedFiles' message. The files to watch must be under the current active workspace. The file names can be specified as a relative paths to the exact file, or as glob patterns following the standard in .gitignore see https://www.kernel.org/pub/software/scm/git/docs/gitignore.html files.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.ILanguageClient.ShowNotificationOnInitializeFailed
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether a notification bubble show be shown when the language server fails to initialize.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.ILanguageClient.OnLoadedAsync
member.summary: This method is called by Visual Studio to notify the extension that the language client has been loaded. The extension can start the LSP server immediately, or wait for user action to start. To start the server call and await on the event before returning from this method.
member.returns: A Task which completes when actions that need to be performed when extension is loaded are done.
member.remarks: If a language client doesn't await the call before returning from , it may not receive messages and notifications related to user interactions initiated before the completion of the call.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.ILanguageClient.OnServerInitializedAsync
member.summary: This method is called by Visual Studio to notify the extension that the LSP server has been initialized: LSP "initialize" and "initialized" messages have been exchanged.
member.returns: A which completes when actions that need to be performed when the server is ready are done.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.ILanguageClient.ActivateAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: This method is called by Visual Studio to notify the extension that the LSP server should be started.
member.param: Cancellation token.
member.returns: A object; or null if the language server cannot be started.

remarks.para: Any exceptions thrown here will be caught and displayed to users.

This method is normally called by Visual Studio while handling the event, before returning from such event. Visual Studio can call again, in case the with the server is closed, in order to activate the server again.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.ILanguageClient.OnServerInitializeFailedAsync(Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.ILanguageClientInitializationInfo)
member.summary: This method is called by Visual Studio to notify the extension that the initialization of the LSP server has failed.
member.param: Object containing information about the point reached during initialization to help identify the source and whether this is a recoverable error.
member.returns: A which completes when actions that need to be performed when the server fails to initialize are done and returns a instance with the context of the failure for the specific language client. Can be null if the client wants to show the error in a different way.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.ILanguageClientBroker
member.summary: Contract used to broker ILanguageClient instances with the platform.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.ILanguageClientBroker.LoadAsync(Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.ILanguageClientMetadata,Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.ILanguageClient)
member.summary: Loads a language client.
member.param: Content type of the language client.
The language client.
member.returns: A task that completes when loading completes.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.ILanguageClientCustomMessage2
member.summary: Interface that provides custom message contract using StreamJsonRpc v2.
member.remarks: All of the methods defined in this interface must be implemented and should not default to throw .

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.ILanguageClientCustomMessage2.MiddleLayer
member.summary: Gets the middle layer object that can intercept outgoing requests and responses.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.ILanguageClientCustomMessage2.CustomMessageTarget
member.summary: Gets the target object for receiving custom messages not covered by the language server protocol.
member.remarks: If left null, then custom messages won't be delivered.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.ILanguageClientCustomMessage2.AttachForCustomMessageAsync(StreamJsonRpc.JsonRpc)
member.summary: This method is called after the language server has been activated, but connection has not been established.
member.param: The object used to send custom messages to the language server.
member.returns: A task that completes when the language client is ready to send custom messages to the language server.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.ILanguageClientDocumentManager
member.summary: Interface representing a client which provides document management functionality in IDE such as opening documents and ensuring documents exist on disk.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.ILanguageClientDocumentManager.EnsureFileExistsAsync(System.Uri)
member.summary: Asks the language client to create a local copy of a document and return the local file path.
member.param: Document URI that was returned by language client in response to an LSP query.
member.returns: Local path to the file on disk or null if URI couldn't be recognized or converted to a local path.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.ILanguageClientInitializationInfo
member.summary: Interface representing various information useful about the status of the initialization of the language client.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.ILanguageClientInitializationInfo.Status
member.summary: Gets an Enum representing the status reached during initialization.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.ILanguageClientInitializationInfo.InitializationException
member.summary: Gets the exception that was thrown during initialization. May be null if no exception was thrown.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.ILanguageClientInitializationInfo.IsInitialized
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the clien was correctly initialized.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.ILanguageClientInitializationInfo.StatusMessage
member.summary: Gets a human-readable string telling the status of the initialization.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.ILanguageClientMetadata
member.summary: Metadata describing an ILanguageClient.
member.remarks: This is used when one choosed to load an ILanguageClient without going through MEF.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.ILanguageClientMetadata.ClientName
member.summary: Gets the value which indicates client name.
member.remarks: Used to indicate a particular client should be activated when the specified name matches the specified in the buffer property. Multiple language clients can share this same name.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.ILanguageClientMiddleLayer
member.summary: Interface representing a client which can intercept language server messages and implement custom behaviour around them.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.ILanguageClientMiddleLayer.CanHandle(System.String)
member.summary: This method is called to determine if this middle layer is capable of intercepting the given method.
member.param: The name of the method to be intercepted.
member.returns: True if the given method can be intercepted, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.ILanguageClientMiddleLayer.HandleRequestAsync(System.String,Newtonsoft.Json.Linq.JToken,System.Func{Newtonsoft.Json.Linq.JToken,System.Threading.Tasks.Task{Newtonsoft.Json.Linq.JToken}})
member.summary: Intercepts JSON-RPC request calls for .
member.param: The name of the method that is being intercepted.
Parameter to be sent for the request.

Function delegate which will send the request to the server. This delegate can be ignored and not invoked if the choice is to not send the request to the server. It must be invoked in this method if the choice is to send the request to the server.
member.returns: A corresponding to a valid response for the given method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.ILanguageClientMiddleLayer.HandleNotificationAsync(System.String,Newtonsoft.Json.Linq.JToken,System.Func{Newtonsoft.Json.Linq.JToken,System.Threading.Tasks.Task})
member.summary: Intercepts JSON-RPC notification calls for .
member.param: The name of the method that is being intercepted.
Parameter to be sent for the notification.

Function delegate which will send the notification to the server. This delegate can be ignored and not invoked if the choice is to not send the notification to the server. It must be invoked in this method if the choice is to send the notification to the server.
member.returns: A that completes once the notification has been sent.

member.summary: Boot if running as guest.

member.summary: Boot if running as Host.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.RunOnContextAttribute
member.summary: Export attribute which can be used to signify that a language client will only be activated in certain LiveShare context.
member.remarks: When the client is only made to run on Host and not activated on the Guest side this attibute is set to RunOnHost to avoid mirroing the results over LiveShare. This attribute is currently used to support LiveShare scenarios.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Value which indicates the context in which the language client can be activated.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.RunOnContextAttribute.RunOnContext
member.summary: Gets a value indicating the context in which the client can be activated.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.ProvideWorkspaceSettingsAttribute
member.summary: ProvideWorkspaceSettingsAttribute class. Registers a workspace settings file for use in OpenFolder settings.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The type of settings (e.g. "VSWorkspaceSettings").
Relative path to the settings.json file that exists inside of the extension.

member.summary: Gets the type of settings (e.g. "VSWorkspaceSettings").

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.ProvideWorkspaceSettingsAttribute.RelativeSettingsJsonPath
member.summary: Gets the relative path to the settings.json file that exists inside of the extension.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Client.ProvideWorkspaceSettingsAttribute.SettingName
member.summary: Gets or sets the setting name. Defaults to a random GUID generated during the construction of the object.
